title: Getting started
text: package two unique selections functions based different needs Pregnancy 24/7 study team.
code: library(pregnancy247)

title: Getting started
text: first selection includes read_msleep(), check_msleep(), write_msleep(), write_all_msleep(), quality_check() functions. read_msleep() function imports sleep nap data exported Actiwatch screened valid data check_msleep(), write_msleep() write_all_msleep() export screend data. Rules valid data may found vingettes. quality_check() interface functions ease use. example utility interface presented . Currently, check Actiwatch data appropriately, working directory must main directory containing data subject within subject-specific folders based IDs. also assumed names folders subject-specific directories Visit 1, Visit 2, Visit 3
code: quality_check(subject = "1000-AB", trimester = 1)

what: Actiwatch, activPAL, and diary data processing
title: Getting started
text: second selection functions includes remaining functions listed process Actiwatch, activPAL, diary data. process_data() function provides main interface functions based needs Pregnancy 24/7 study. example utility interface presented . Currently, process data appropriately, need working directory set directory containing DATA_Iowa_activPAL, DATA_Pitt_activPAL, DATA_WVU_activPAL sub-directories data subject-specific directories within sub-directory. Additionally, also assumes visit study period concatenation subject ID trimester. viewing package basis code research study, need make changes functions depend file system.
code: process_data(subject = "1000-AB", trimester = 1, sleep_source = "./sleep.csv")

Usually, processing stopped investigation time missing needed. data processor aware missing time like continue processing data, answer . processing may also stop subject shift-worker sleep one wear days. subject sleep day, stop data processing add sleep interval 1 minute day sleep sleep diary (e.g. 23:58 23:59). , process data stop data processing due subject shift-worker. data dictionary sleep_source data set may downloaded inst/extdata Github site package.

title: Process data for the Pregnancy 24/7 study
text: entire creation process_data() depends check_dir(), read_sleep(), read_events(), windows(), process_events(), merge_events(), create_1s_epoch(), plot_1s_epoch(), summarize_daily(), write() functions pregnancy247/R package. R object returned function, files written appropriate subject-specific directories based subject trimester parameters. total six data objects exported description data objects presented . Events data collection activity events occurred wear period. Additionally, indicator variables created denote sleep, naps, work times. variables named sleep_loop, nap_loop, work_loop, respectively. wear_day variable denotes day wear period, wear day begins sleep window. Thus, second wear day begins subject goes sleep day 1. outputted data set named ####-ab(t)_eventfile.csv, (t) denoting trimester pregnancy. One second EPOCH data expanded version events data second second accounting activity wear period. outputted data set named ####-ab(t)_1secepoch.csv, (t) denoting trimester pregnancy. Daily values data collection daily movement sedentary metrics. values calculated using archived activpalProcessing package. default, days 1 9 used activity analysis. However, one wear days less 10 hours activPAL wear, day 1 may considered analysis least 10 hours wear. outputted data set named ####-ab(t)_daily_values.csv, (t) denoting trimester pregnancy. Additionally, weekly averages included site-specific data set weekly movement sedentary metrics. data sets weekly_avgs_IOWA.csv University Iowa, weekly_avgs_PITT.csv University Pittsburgh, weekly_avgs_WVU.csv West Virginia University. Graph wear day activity saved PDF. outputted graph named ####-ab(t)_graph.pdf, (t) denoting trimester pregnancy. data dictionaries outputted data sets may downloaded inst/extdata/outdata/ Github site package. file names dictionaries related outputted data sets.

title: Data procressing for the Pregnancy 24/7 study
text: can install development version pregnancy247 GitHub : added installation call package called activpalProcessing package longer available CRAN. archived copy package used. , activpalProcessing must installed prior installing pregnancy247.
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("deboonstra/activpalProcessing") remotes::install_github("deboonstra/pregnancy247")

title: Data procressing for the Pregnancy 24/7 study
text: package two unique selections functions based different needs Pregnancy 24/7 study team. two main functions package, interfaces functions package. functions quality_check() process_data(). first function checks quality recorded Actiwatch data, second processes Actiwatch, sleep diary, activPAL data.
code: library(pregnancy247) quality_check(subject = "1000-AB", trimester = 1) process_data(subject = "1000-AB", trimester = 1, sleep_source = "./sleep.csv")

what: Estimate the number of sit to stand transitions — breaks_ap
title: Estimate the number of sit to stand transitions — breaks_ap
text: function estimates number sit stand transitions, values 0 indicates sitting, 1 indicates standings, 2 indicates stepping.

title: Estimate the number of sit to stand transitions — breaks_ap
code: breaks_ap(posture)

title: Estimate the number of sit to stand transitions — breaks_ap
text: posture numeric vector (EPOCH), 0 indicates sitting, 1 indicates standings, 2 indicates stepping.

title: Estimate the number of sit to stand transitions — breaks_ap
text: numeric value indicating number breaks sitting

title: Estimate the number of sit to stand transitions — breaks_ap
text: essentially activpalProcessing::breaks.AP(); however, *sit stand transitations value 0 returned instead NA.

title: Estimate the number of sit to stand transitions — breaks_ap
code: x <- sample(x = c(0, 1, 2), size = 100, replace = TRUE, prob = rep(1/3, 3)) breaks_ap(x) #> [1] 26

code: check_dir(path = ".")

title: Checking current working directory — check_dir
text: path character vector full path names; default corresponds working directory, getwd(). Also, path sets working directory setwd(path).

title: Checking current working directory — check_dir
text: Error message returned current working directory appropriate sub-directories else nothing returned.

title: Checking current working directory — check_dir
code: # check_dir() # works if current directory has sub-directories # check_dir(path = ".") # works if current directory has sub-directories # check_dir(path = "../") # error by moving out of current directory

what: Screening the sleep or nap data. — check_msleep
title: Screening the sleep or nap data. — check_msleep
text: Screening sleep nap Actiwatch data subject imported read_msleep() outlier values based expertise Christopher E. Kline.

title: Screening the sleep or nap data. — check_msleep
code: check_msleep(x, y = NULL, nap = FALSE, cutpoint = 30)

title: Screening the sleep or nap data. — check_msleep
text: x msleep object imported read_msleep(). y optional msleep object used screening nap data collected Actiwatch. Default NULL, coincides default value nap. nap Logical denoting nap data screened outlying values. Default FALSE. cutpoint numeric value denoting amount time minutes see nap sleep overlap. Default 30 minutes.

title: Screening the sleep or nap data. — check_msleep
text: msleep object, data.frame containing two additional variables flag1 flag2. flag1 variable contains values 0, 1, missing, 0 denotes issues observation, 1 denotes least one issue observation, missing denotes value missing observation. flag2 values provides comment value flag1.

title: Screening the sleep or nap data. — check_msleep
text: parameter y specified nap = TRUE sleep data exported Actiwatch. Also, cutpoint used nap = TRUE. Overlapping nap sleep windows part screening nap data collected Actiwatch.

title: Screening the sleep or nap data. — check_msleep
code: if (FALSE) { # sleep msleep <- read_msleep(subject = "1000-AB", trimester = 3) msleep_test <- check_msleep(x = msleep) # nap mnap <- read_msleep(subject = "1000-AB", trimester = 3, nap = TRUE) mnap_test <- check(x = mnap, y = msleep, nap = TRUE) }

title: Merge event data together — merge_events
text: data process.data.events object produced process_events() add_events data.frame events merge data variable names data. start_time date-time (POSIXct) value denotes first date time recorded merged data set. Default NA indicate merge data set need subsetted. end_time date-time (POSIXct) value denotes last date time recorded merged data set. Default NA indicate merge data set need subsetted. off_times list containing two objects equal length denoting beginning ending times monitors removed. Pregnancy 24/7 study, windows_monitor() function used find times. Default NULL, indicates monitor times. good_days integer vector denoting wear days valid data. default 1:9, Pregnancy 24/7 study wear period last nine days. remove_days logical denoting merge data set subsetted good_days. Default FALSE.

text: merge.data.events object, data.frame variables data plus event variable.

title: Levels of physical activity — mpa_min_ap
text: Determines many moderate, vigrous, moderate-vigrous physical activity minutes occurred given interval.

title: Levels of physical activity — mpa_min_ap
text: mets numeric vectors METs (metabolic equivalents). epoch Length interval, default 1 second.

title: Levels of physical activity — mpa_min_ap
text: Numeric vector denoting number minutes.

title: Levels of physical activity — mpa_min_ap
text: functions similar activpalProcessing::mvpa.min.AP() function METs cutoff values used define levels activity adjusted. METs [3, 6) define moderate physical activity METs greater equal 6 define vigrous physical activity METs greater equal 3 define moderate-vigrous physical activity

title: Graphing events — plot_1s_epoch
text: data one.epoch.data object created create_1s_epoch(). sleep_times data.frame contains information sleep nap windows wear period. data set must contain following variables default NULL denoting sleep data need included. date-time object named sleep_start denoting sleep nap onset date-time object named sleep_stop denoting sleep nap wake times integer vector named day denoting wear day character vector named label denoting type sleep plot logical denoting plot appear.

title: Graphing events — plot_1s_epoch
text: ggplot2::ggplot() object may displayed saved later.

title: Graphing events — plot_1s_epoch
text: Activities generally grouped 300 second intervals; however, day last 300 seconds activities grouped 50 second intervals. specific acitivies examined plot standing, walking, laying.

title: Graphing events — plot_1s_epoch
code: if (FALSE) { process_dat <- process_events(data = dat) sec_by_sec <- create_1s_epoch(data = process_dat) g <- plot_1s_epoch(sec_by_sec) }

title: Manipulate the events data recorded by activPAL — process_events
text: functions rearranges variables produced activPAL software selects variables related : time, datacount, interval, activity, cummulativesteps, methrs. naming variables based archived package named activpalProcessing created Kate Lynden. Beyond variable selection, function specifically: doubles cumulativesteps activPAL device one leg, transforms time variable date-time (POSIXct) numeric vector based UTC time-zone, creates several new variables indicate: wear day based sleep onset (wear_day), sleep windows (sleep_loop), nap windows (nap_loop), wake windows (wake_loop), work windows (work_loop) missing values filled later appropriate data.

title: Export 1 second EPOCH plot — save_plot_1s_epoch
code: if (FALSE) { process_dat <- process_events(data = dat) sec_by_sec <- create_1s_epoch(data = process_dat) g <- plot_1s_epoch(sec_by_sec) save_plot_1s_epoch(x = g, subject = "0001-AB", 1, width = 11, height = 8.5) }

what: Determine event windows for activities — windows
title: Determine event windows for activities — windows
text: Determine sleep, nap, work, monitor wear windows recorded Actiwatch subject diary.

title: Determine event windows for activities — windows
code: windows_sleep(sleep)  windows_nap(sleep, interval = "first")  windows_work(sleep)  windows_monitor(sleep)

title: Determine event windows for activities — windows
text: sleep data.sleep object produced read_sleep(). interval windows_nap(), character taking value "first" "second" denote first second napping windows. Default "first".

title: Determine event windows for activities — windows
text: list containing two numeric vectors named start end formatted date-time (POSIXct) based UTC time-zone.

title: Determine event windows for activities — windows
text: functions require data.sleep object used type object contains specific variable names determine daily windows sleep, naps, work, monitor wear. sleep nap windows may soley times recorded Actiwatch, tracks information based activity, light, event markers. Variables end input denote sleep nap windows recorded. list input values relation times record. 1 denotes event marker time 2 denotes white light time 3 denotes diary record time 4 denotes activity time windows initialing created diary dates recorded subject. dates times altered based time day relation initial date. example, suppose subject 0001-AB records information diary 01-01-2023, including sleep onset wake times. Pregnancy 24/7 study, start day begins sleep onset. , sleep onset wake times initially start date need altered wake time 6:00 actually recorded occur 01-02-2023 01-01-2023. , sleep onset time 12:00 , date recorded 01-02-2023. windows_work() windows_monitor() soley based times recorded subject log. window creation functions also may require user input missing date time. prompt question whether proceed processing windows given certain day missing data. known time certain days invalid data missing data may problem, invalid data excluded later. interval parameter windows_nap allows recording two naps day wear period. assumed second napping intervals variable names end _b#, # denotes wear day.

title: Determine event windows for activities — windows
code: if (FALSE) { wind_sleep <- windows_sleep(sleep = sleep) sleep_start <- wind_sleep$start sleep_end <- wind_sleep$end }  if (FALSE) { wind_nap <- windows_nap(sleep = sleep) nap_start <- wind_nap$start nap_end <- wind_nap$end }  if (FALSE) { wind_work <- windows_work(sleep = sleep) work_start <- wind_work$start work_end <- wind_work$end }  if (FALSE) { wind_monitor <- windows_monitor(sleep = sleep) monitor_off <- wind_monitor$start monitor_on <- wind_monitor$end }
